Stash: Backpack \nPut the spare suit into a backpack and shoved it under the boulders, behind the fallen tree.
Stash: Backpack \nFeels like not many drinkers wander around here. A quiet place.

Stash: Crate in a UAZ \nRuslan Didenko blurted out by the campfire yesterday that when they were coming from Dark Valley, they spotted all kinds of useful hardware in the trunk of a UAZ. There was a whole AK in there, plus repair kits. Didn't take anything since they were already loaded like camels.
Stash: Crate in a UAZ \nDropped excess weight into a crate in the UAZ.
Stash: Crate in a UAZ \nFound a pristine AK and ammo for it near an army convoy. Decided to leave it here. Will be a spare piece, just in case.
Stash: Crate under the Bus \nA busted container doesn't block radiation worth a damn, tossed it under the bus. Need to come back with a proper one and pick it up.
Stash: Crate under the Bus \nVergas said there's a lot of abandoned machinery in the Gut, stalkers bring him spare parts from there. Sent me the coordinates.
Stash: Crate under the Bus \nWas coming back from Raven when those burer bastards pinned me by the bus, tossed the crate under the cab.
Stash: Signalmen's Crate \nThe guys were saying that under the railway bridge in the Gut it's a creepy spot. The army convoy didn't stop there for nothing. That's where you need to poke around.
Stash: Signalmen's Crate \nThe guys were saying that under the railway bridge in the Gut it's a creepy spot. The army convoy didn't stop there for nothing. That's where you need to poke around.
Stash: Signalmen's Crate \nThe guys were saying that under the railway bridge in the Gut it's a creepy spot. The army convoy didn't stop there for nothing. That's where you need to poke around.
Stash: Pipe \nThe hunter patrol sitting by the high-voltage tower hide their loot in a pipe under a slab.
Stash: Pipe \nShoved the artifact into a pipe under the slab so it wouldn't glow in front of the guys. I'll go see Sidor later, trade it for some decent grub.
Stash: Pipe \nSaw the hunters hiding something in a pipe under a slab, near the high-voltage tower.
Stash: Scientists' Crate \nnot used
Stash: Scientists' Crate \nnot used
Stash: Scientists' Crate \nnot used
Stash: Green Crate \nThere's a decent supply of provisions in the signalman's hut.
Stash: Green Crate \nIn the railway workers' hut there's a whole crate of hunting ammo.
Stash: Green Crate \nStashed dry rations and vodka in the station watchman's hut, might come in handy.
Stash: Backpack in the Stove \nFleshes drove us into the hut, had to get rid of excess weight and retreat light.
Stash: Backpack in the Stove \nPut pelts and an artifact here for a future coat. One more and I'll stitch it myself.
Stash: Backpack in the Stove \nTimokha got taken out in a skirmish with the army, we buried him not far from the signalman's hut. Stuffed the piece into the stove.
Stash: Backpack in the Shed \nMax headed off to the Foggy Thicket, asked me to stash his backpack for the time being. Let it lie here for now, the place is quiet.
Stash: Backpack in the Shed \nStashed vodka and matches in the shed on the farmstead. An irreplaceable thing on night raids.
Stash: Backpack in the Shed \nStored a peashooter, buckshot, and a couple of grenades in the shed. Nimble always wanted to get his hands on something like this.
Stash: Backpack in the Outhouse \nTimokha drowned his backpack in the outhouse on the farmstead. Didn't have the stomach to fish it out.
Stash: Backpack in the Outhouse \nTimokha drowned his backpack in the outhouse on the farmstead. Didn't have the stomach to fish it out.
Stash: Backpack in the Outhouse \nTimokha drowned his backpack in the outhouse on the farmstead. Didn't have the stomach to fish it out.
Stash: Backpack in the Stove \nGot myself a decent piece, but still haven't found ammo. Hid it in the stove.
Stash: Backpack in the Stove \nStashed vodka in the stove. The place seems deserted enough.
Stash: Backpack in the Stove \nTraded with the hunters for buckshot with a reserve. Hid it in the stove of a ruined house.
Stash: Rusty Crate \nSet myself up with a repair crate. Good to hole up on the farmstead between raids-quiet and peaceful, not a soul around.
Stash: Rusty Crate \nDumped ammo I didn't need for the time being into a crate on the farmstead. I check in on it from time to time.
Stash: Rusty Crate \nDug up a rare piece from some drifters, parked it in a crate in the attic for now.
Stash: Crate in the Attic \nAmmo, food, meds, assorted small stuff-all dumped into a crate in the attic. I'm no camel to haul all that around. It'll be a stash for the next run.

Stash: Crate in the Attic \nVitka the Skinny got into it with Sidor, so Sidor spread the word about him to all the traders. If not for this crate, Skinny would've quit long ago. This way everyone's happy-he puts the artifacts he finds into the crate, I put in gear and the money I get from Sidor.
Stash: Crate in the Attic \nZhora said he hid a decent assault rifle in the attic of a house by the marsh. I haven't checked.
Stash: Torn Mercenary Suit \nNo time to think-wrapped the loot in the suit and stashed it here.
Stash: Torn Mercenary Suit \nWe were coming back loaded from the Swamps, wrapped the excess in a jacket and tossed it behind the shed.
Stash: Torn Mercenary Suit \nRostik went missing in the Swamps, everything that was left is hidden in the jacket behind the shed.
Stash: Stalker Supplies \nThe locals keep food and booze there.
Stash: Stalker Supplies \nThe stalkers keep a small reserve of ammo in the house.
Stash: Stalker Supplies \nDenya swore the stalkers keep all their artifacts they've äîáûed in that crate. Still young, that's why he believes everything people blurt out.
Stash: Hide in a Suit \nWrapped a piece in an old armor vest and hid it in the shed. The Chatterbox will sell it off to the youngsters later.
Stash: Hide in a Suit \nSeveral packs of slugs and canister shot are stashed in the shed. Wrapped them in a suit.
Stash: Hide in a Suit \nWrapped the artifacts in an old suit, in the shed. Rostik promised to tip me off where I could sell them for a better price.
Stash: Toolbox \nStashed some ammo for the 47 in the cab of a Ural on the farmstead.
Stash: Toolbox \nBogdan passed through the farmstead, saw a little toolbox in a torn-off cab.
Stash: Toolbox \nZyama saw two outsiders snooping around the farmstead near the torn-off cab of the Ural. Might be worth checking.
Stash: Under the Trough \nWanted to pick up an artifact, but dogs came running. Only managed to shove it under the trough at the old farm. I'll come back for it later.
Stash: Under the Trough \nA stash. Nobody's going to look for it in manure under the trough.
Stash: Under the Trough \nPut canned food and other grub at the former farm, under the trough.
Stash: Little Crate on the Wall \nCarelessly left the crate out in the open on the farmstead. Probably already got nicked.
Stash: Little Crate on the Wall \nWheezy keeps collecting all kinds of junk we dump on him. Says he'll be fabulously rich soon. Just in case, I marked where he hauls all that stuff.
Stash: Little Crate on the Wall \nDumped assorted junk into a crate so I wouldn't have to lug it around, then tossed it up on the wall. People don't usually look up high.
Stash: Crate in the Attic \nRoma Korobov dragged in some real weird crap the other day! Won't say where from. Hid it in the attic for the time being.
Stash: Crate in the Attic \nThe guys nicked a crate of grenades from the army at night, spread them out across different stashes.
Stash: Crate in the Attic \nRan into a dead soldier on the farmstead, got caught in Witch's Jelly. Hid his “big iron” up in the attic.
Stash: Crate in the Store \nSome fool left a suit out in plain sight. Hauled it off to the store, ought to offer it to the rookies in the village.
Stash: Crate in the Store \nA rusty piece, no way to pawn it off anymore. Dumped it into a crate in the Groceries.
Stash: Crate in the Store \nTook a crate of supplies to the store beyond the radioactive swamp. They'll be too scared to go poking around there.

Stash: Backpack in the Attic \nThis place is strange and extremely dangerous. Barely managed to reach the attic and dump all the loot there-otherwise I wouldn't have made it out. Now I don't even know how I'm supposed to retrieve those artifacts.

Stash: Backpack in the Attic \nThis place is strange and extremely dangerous. Barely managed to reach the attic and dump all the loot there-otherwise I wouldn't have made it out. Now I don't even know how I'm supposed to retrieve those artifacts.

Stash: Backpack in the Attic \nThis place is strange and extremely dangerous. Barely managed to reach the attic and dump all the loot there-otherwise I wouldn't have made it out. Now I don't even know how I'm supposed to retrieve those artifacts.

Stash: Secret under the Bridge \nThere were plenty of rumors about this little backpack. Supposedly something was left here by a well-armed group of mercenaries. But no one ever had the guts to check. Doesn't matter-I'll definitely get there first.

Stash: Secret under the Bridge \nThere were plenty of rumors about this little backpack. Supposedly something was left here by a well-armed group of mercenaries. But no one ever had the guts to check. Doesn't matter-I'll definitely get there first.

Stash: Secret under the Bridge \nThere were plenty of rumors about this little backpack. Supposedly something was left here by a well-armed group of mercenaries. But no one ever had the guts to check. Doesn't matter-I'll definitely get there first.
Stash: Scientists' Supplies \nWe've reached the destination. The guide was killed a couple of hours ago. We'll dump all the heavy stuff here for now. Time to head back.
Stash: Scientists' Supplies \nLooks like we've chosen a decent spot for a temporary depot. We'll leave the medical supplies and food here.

Stash: Scientists' Supplies \nI'm the only one left... The whole group was wiped out by some unusual chimera, I barely made it out alive. Dumping everything unnecessary into this backpack and getting the hell out of here.
Stash: Pipe in a Pit \nThe run turned out very productive, I can't carry everything. I'll leave it here for now and come back later.
Stash: Pipe in a Pit \nBought a tip from Wheezy yesterday. Somewhere around here there should be something very valuable.
Stash: Pipe in a Pit \nHid a valuable artifact in the pipe. Let it sit there until better times.
Stash: Crate in the Reeds \nHid all the artifacts I've collected lately here. No one will find them.
Stash: Crate in the Reeds \nHid all the artifacts I've collected lately here. No one will find them.
Stash: Crate in the Reeds \nHid all the artifacts I've collected lately here. No one will find them.
Stash: Bandit Common Fund \nThe bandits are hiding something under a pipe, gotta go check it out. From the chatter, sounds like food supplies.
Stash: Bandit Common Fund \nThe bandits are hiding something under a pipe, gotta pay a visit. From the talk, it's clear those are their supplies.
Stash: Bandit Common Fund \nMe and Wheezy tossed the artifacts we shook off some suckers into the common fund. About time we scored a proper container.
Stash: Backpack in the Alley \nFlashlight batteries are dying-time to get outta here. Hid the backpack with extra junk behind chunks of concrete, gonna move light. Better hungry than dead.
Stash: Backpack in the Alley \nStumbled onto someone's loot in the underground. The stash is all covered in cobwebs, clearly abandoned. I'll check it on the way back.
Stash: Backpack in the Alley \nHid the backpack behind chunks of concrete, heading out light. Better hungry than alive.

Stash: Bloodsucker's Crate \nThe crate's behind a rusty barrel in the underground, everything's there. I'm not going back there-no way! Still can't figure out how I even managed to drop that bloodsucker.
Stash: Bloodsucker's Crate \nA crate with armor, behind a rusty barrel in the underground. Still don't remember by what miracle I crushed that bloodsucker.
Stash: Bloodsucker's Crate \nFound a soldier stuck in Witch's Jelly, some stuff survived. Stashed it here.
Stash: Stalker Loot \nSome nosy stalker got whacked. The loot he dragged in was dumped here.
Stash: Stalker Loot \nHrytsiuk said stalkers hide their loot there.
Stash: Stalker Loot \nThe loot's behind the wall. I stand by my word!
Stash: Mole's Burrow \nDug up some valuables. A clever little spot, on the yellow barrel. Left it there for better times.
Stash: Mole's Burrow \nSpotted a little sack of loot on the tank. Didn't get a chance to check it-army sent a patrol into the underground.
Stash: Mole's Burrow \nI dug up something valuable here and picked a nice hiding spot. On the yellow barrel-no outsider'll ever find it!
Stash: Little Crate in the Attic \nCame to check on the Doctor, get patched up. Put the capsule here, don't feel like lugging it around.
Stash: Little Crate in the Attic \nThey say the Swamp Doctor keeps his medical supplies here.
Stash: Little Crate in the Attic \nA crate in the attic of a little house in the middle of that damn thicket... What could be in there?

Stash: Loot in the Electrical Panel \nThere are rumors about a stalker who managed to get into this lab and hid his loot in an electrical panel in the elevator shaft. But he never managed to retrieve it.

Stash: Loot in the Electrical Panel \nThere are rumors that a stalker once crawled into this laboratory and hid his loot in an electrical panel in the elevator shaft. But he was never able to take it back.
Stash: Loot in the Electrical Panel \nCopied down the coordinates of a beacon from Sakharov that was transmitting from the laboratory. Could very well be someone's stash.
Stash: Scout's Backpack \nRumor has it a stalker broke into this lab, but he got killed in the area where the experiments were being conducted. All his gear is still there.
Stash: Scout's Backpack \nThere are rumors of a stalker who got into this lab, but he kicked the bucket near the cages with the test subjects, along with all his loot.
Stash: Scout's Backpack \nThey say a stalker once crawled into this laboratory and ended up dying somewhere near the cages with the test subjects, together with all his loot.

Stash: Smoked's Hideout \nIn the underground laboratory, Smoked put everything into a safe. Not a bad place: nobody has keys to that lab. One problem though-rocks sometimes just start flying through the air on their own. They even said someone got killed by that.
Stash: Smoked's Hideout \nJotted down the coordinates of an underground stash from some drunk stalker. Gotta be a tasty find.

Stash: Smoked's Hideout \nSmoked, the idiot, hauled all our artifacts into the underground lab and locked them in a safe there. Found a place, sure... Rocks fly around there out of nowhere-how are we supposed to get them out now?..
Stash: Abandoned Backpack \nHad to ditch the backpack with junk in the lab. Those damn things turned out to be heavy.
Stash: Abandoned Backpack \nHad to leave the big lump inside and get the hell out in a hurry.
Stash: Abandoned Backpack \nHad to throw the backpack away in the underground laboratory.
Stash: Dangerous Secret \nPolters pinned me down, couldn't haul everything away. Dumped it all here.
Stash: Dangerous Secret \nRumor has it someone from Strelok's own group kept their gear here.
Stash: Dangerous Secret \nBodya, that drunk mug, let it slip about a stash in one of the X-labs, heh-heh. I'll write it down-oughta pay it a visit...
Stash: Mystery in the Laboratory \nI was here once, a long time ago. Creepy as hell place. I clearly remember dumping something here, but what exactly-it's gone from my head. Now try and guess...
Stash: Mystery in the Laboratory \nHad to abandon my favorite SMG along with a whole pile of ammo for it. Who knew you'd need a flamethrower in here?
Stash: Mystery in the Laboratory \nVaska said that on his last visit here he ditched part of his ammo. Idiot... how's he gonna get it back now?
Stash: Valuables in X-18 \nIgnat's people are idiots! How am I supposed to retrieve the order from that basement now?!
Stash: Valuables in X-18 \nBought a tip off some sucker. It's somewhere around here, but damn if it ain't scary to crawl in.
Stash: Valuables in X-18 \nWas drinking with a stalker, and he told me there's something interesting lying around here. Was he bullshitting?
